alert.note: Alert for Clay; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 11:09AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Richland and Clay Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1109 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clay City, or 10 miles east of Flora, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Olney and Calhoun around 1120 AM CDT. Claremont around 1125 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for south central and southeastern Illinois.
